(leave only one on its own line)** /kind bug **Description** <!-- Briefly describe the problem you are having in a few paragraphs. --> When not using systemd but having procfs option hidepid=invisible enabled, the systemd check we default to assuming it is a systemd system. Which then means slirp4netns will error in `podman-compose up` (#13703). **Steps to reproduce the issue:** 1. Setup rootless podman on openrc distro 2. Enable hidepid=2: add to /etc/fstab ``` proc /proc proc defaults,hidepid=2 0 0 ``` 3. Reboot so changes take effect 4. Try to create network with podman **Describe the results you received:** Podman thinks I am using systemd so tries to move slirp4netns with dbus-launch, which fails **Describe the results you expected:** Either detection fails to assume no systemd or there is some config override I can set to manually tell podman there is no systemd. **Additional information you deem important (e.g. issue happens only occasionally):** https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/12655484e39eadbc0fa0607542aa4a49a21013a1/utils/utils.go#L116-L118 **Output of `podman version`:** ``` Client: Podman Engine Version: 4.2.1 API Version: 4.2.1 Go Version: go1.19.1 Built: Thu Sep 29 00:18:43 2022 OS/Arch: linux/arm64 ``` <details><summary> **Output of `podman info`:** </summary> ``` host: arch: arm64 buildahVersion: 1.27.0 cgroupControllers: - BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #16219 from dfr/freebsd-install Makefile: don't install systemd generator binaries on FreeBSD

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Replace the check for systemd Remove the check for pid 1's cmdline and replace it with checking for the existence of "/run/systemd/system" (a valid check according to sd_booted's man page). Closes #16022

fix incorrect systemd booted check Check for the directory /run/systemd/system, this is described in sd_booted(3). Reading /proc/1/comm will fail when /proc is mounted with the `hidepid=2` option. [NO NEW TESTS NEEDED] Fixes #16022 Signed-off-by: Paul Holzinger <pholzing@redhat.com>
